title: Product Owner (Interim from May 2025)
description:
Tradera is a purpose-driven company with a belief that consumption has a large impact on our planet. We’re determined to use what we control – our business, our voice, our creativity, and our platform – to do something about it. At Tradera, we’re on a mission to ‘Drive the Transition to Sustainable Shopping,’ by shifting the way people consume and resell preloved goods.


We are looking for an Interim Product Owner for Buyer Experience to join us and help shape the buying journey across tradera.com and Tradera’s iOS and Android apps. This is a 9-month assignment starting in May 2025.

 **About the Role**


The Buyer Experience team’s mission is to make buying second-hand as seamless and enjoyable as buying new. As Product Owner for Buyer Experience, you will work close with our CPO and play a key role in achieving this by prioritizing features, resolving bugs, and delivering improvements that enhance the user experience across Tradera’s platforms.


In addition to owning the product backlog, you will also take on the role of people manager for the development team, which consists of 7 developers. You will be responsible for supporting their growth, fostering collaboration, and ensuring the team remains focused and motivated to deliver.


This role requires someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, where priorities and requirements can shift quickly. The ability to adapt and maintain focus on delivering value is key to success.

 **Key Responsibilities**


* Drive the development of features and improvements that make second-hand shopping as simple and engaging as buying new items.
* Prioritize the product backlog, balancing user feedback, bug fixes, and new initiatives.




* Lead the team in planning and delivering updates across Tradera’s web and app platforms.

* Collaborate closely with developers, UX/design, marketing, and other stakeholders to align priorities and ensure smooth execution.
* Act as people manager for a development team of 7, providing guidance, feedback, and support to foster growth and high performance.

 **Who Are You?**


You are a results-driven leader with a strong ability to prioritize and deliver meaningful outcomes. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where priorities can change quickly, and you are passionate about leading development teams to achieve great results.


To be successful in this role, you should have:


* Experience prioritizing features, bugs, and improvements based on user feedback and business impact.
* A proven track record of leading development teams and working collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders.
* Strong organizational skills and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.

 **Why Join Tradera?**


At Tradera, you’ll have the opportunity to work on meaningful projects that contribute to sustainable shopping while collaborating with a talented team. Your role will be pivotal in making second-hand shopping the easy and enjoyable choice, shaping the future of how people consume preloved goods.


Come and join us – Don’t be square, get circular!

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
*Every year, 6 billion SEK of personal accident insurance compensation goes unclaimed in Sweden! Why so?*


Navigating the insurance claims process is often complicated, requiring time, knowledge, and patience. At Insurello, we empower customers to get more value from their insurance through personalized insights and innovative solutions. We've already helped **over 43,000 people** claim more than **900 million SEK**, and our customer count continues to grow every hour.


We believe our product has the potential to transform an industry often seen as complex and opaque, offering a digital solution that makes life easier for millions of people. Now, we are looking for an empathetic and strategic **Senior Product Manager** to lead our product to the next level.

### **The Role**


Insurello is on a mission to continuously improve its customer promise and product offering. Whether enhancing current products or scoping new features, the **Senior Product Manager** will be at the heart of our product development process. This is a unique opportunity to work with a customer-centric product and drive innovation in our **Claim Helper team**, developing two key aspects of the product:

* the customer sign-up process – including helping users sign up for Insurello’s services and handling follow-up questions to ensure the smoothest and most supportive experience, and
* the CRM system that underpins this process, where the Operations team manages and executes claims efficiently.

Balancing and optimizing these interconnected components will be an exciting challenge.

##### **Your weekly work would include:**

* Guiding an empowered product team to drive product development forward, ensuring a shared understanding of priorities and business context.
* Owning, managing, and prioritizing the product backlog, always guided by a clear product vision.
* Building strong relationships with customers and internal stakeholders to deeply understand user needs and business objectives, enabling informed, data-driven decisions.
* Identifying opportunities, defining goals, and measuring success using KPIs and OKRs.
* Leading product discovery processes and ensuring the team remains aligned on mission and strategy.

### **Who You Are**


We’re looking for someone who combines strategic vision with a collaborative and people-oriented approach. We believe you will thrive in this role, if you:

* Have **5+ years of experience as a Product Manager/Product Owner** working with customer-centric digital products.
* Excel in leading **empowered, cross-functional teams**.
* Are skilled at **stakeholder management**, collaboration, and facilitating alignment.
* Understand how to **define and track product goals** through OKRs, KPIs, and strategic roadmaps.
* Are experienced in **product discovery** processes and prioritizing based on user needs.
* Are mindful of UX and keep **user needs** (and truly able to understand them) close to the heart.
* Believe a **data-driven approach** and **analytical mindset** to be your core strengths.
* Are **fluent in Swedish** – Insurello is an English-first workplace, but Swedish is used for product development.

##### **It’s extra amazing if you:**

* Have experience working in a start-up environment, especially in **FinTech or InsurTech**.
* Have successfully implemented **AI-based projects** or initiatives in product development, using innovative solutions to enhance user experiences or streamline processes.
* Can create a **collaborative team environment** and feel comfortable challenging the team in a positive way to keep moving forward.

### **What We Offer**


At Insurello, we’re more than a workplace – we’re a community on a mission to make a meaningful difference. In this role, you’ll have the chance to:

* Collaborate with diverse team of professionals on creating a difference in people’s lives.
* Engage deeply in strategic initiatives and work closely with leadership to shape the company’s future.
* Tackle exciting product challenges and drive innovation.

##### **Our benefits include**

  

30 days of paid annual vacation


Occupational pension plan in Avanza


️ 5,000 SEK wellness benefit


Flexible hybrid work opportunities with the team based in Stockholm


Personal therapy sessions


Parental pay top-up

### **Our Culture**


At Insurello, we live by our values:

**We care for people** – fostering inclusion, empathy, and support.

**We innovate for impact** – delivering meaningful results for our customers.

**We nurture trust** – valuing transparency and collaboration in all we do.


If you’re an empathetic, collaborative team player with the energy to drive meaningful change, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s transform the insurance industry together!

title: Machine Learning Staff Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

Together with your team, you will design, implement, deploy, and manage machine learning models delivering on organizational goals and industry standards, evolving and maintaining the AI platform.  

  

The AI platform is designed to integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) into business workflows, automating tasks such as summarization, data extraction, and analysis of internal & external data. The platform features a robust architecture enabling the development of scalable AI workflows with a focus on usability, traceability, and domain-specific fine-tuning.  

  

You will be working together with Data Scientists, Fullstack Engineers, Backend Engineers, Data Engineers, UI and UX Designers, and Business Stakeholders to take the platform to the next level and leverage AI as a core part of our strategy to maximize its competitive advantage.  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Technical Leadership and teamwork in product-oriented organizations.


Experience in teams working with disruptive technologies with high level of interaction and collaboration, evolving and maintaining the technical product roadmap according to the business needs.  

  

* AI/ML Systems Architecture: envision, build, deploy, and operationalize end-to-end ML and AI pipelines at scale.

  

* Efficient Text Data Processing: Designing and optimizing systems for processing large volumes of textual data efficiently.

  

* ML Workflows and Pipelines Orchestration: Building and maintaining MLOps pipelines, including CI/CD for machine learning workflows.

  

* AI Cloud Infrastructure: Working with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure for ML infrastructure.

  

**Meritorious**  

* Hands-on experience with LangChain, LangSmith, and LangServe for building and managing AI workflows.

  

* Understanding of FastAPI, TypeScript, GraphQL, and other tools used for backend and frontend integration.

  

* Experience with database technologies and data transformation pipelines (e.g., dbt).

  

* Developing and deploying scalable, distributed systems for AI solutions.

  

* Knowledge of RAGs, Embeddings, vector databases

  

* NLP techniques and tools, particularly for summarization, data extraction, and large-scale textual analysis.

  

**Application deadline:** 11-12-2024  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  

  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Retain
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**

We're looking for Senior Frontend Engineers!

##### **How you will make an impact**


Are you passionate about improving user experiences and driving engagement? Join our new **Retain Team**, where you’ll play a critical role in optimizing the user journey—from onboarding to retention and exit processes. This position is perfect for a data-driven, curious individual who enjoys experimentation and uncovering actionable insights through statistics.


As a team, we value open collaboration, tackling complex technical challenges together, and sharing knowledge through pair and mob programming as well as regular hack weeks. Your insights will shape and influence the team’s roadmap, so we're looking for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment and embraces uncertainty.


Your role will include but not be limited to:

* Analyze user behavior metrics to identify opportunities for boosting engagement and retention.
* Design and test small-scale UX improvements, leveraging data to iterate and refine solutions.
* Optimize onboarding and exit processes to create smooth, impactful user journeys.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement retention strategies across the organization.
* Partner with the Acquisition Team to align strategies for public-facing pages.
* Work with the Commercial Team to deliver a cohesive and seamless user experience.

**Who You Are**

* 5+ years of extensive experience in frontend development.
* Strong expertise in **TypeScript, React, and Next.js/Node.js.**
* An "API-first" approach with an interest in complex architecture and integrations for scalable frontend applications.

**Nice to have:**

* Experience with **subscription services**, or **e-commerce** frontend interfaces.
* Knowledge of **DevOps** tools, such as **Kubernetes** and **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)**.
* Familiarity with **A/B testing methodologies** and an experimentation mindset to refine UX through data-driven insights.

**Soft Skills**

* **Adaptability:** Quickly adjust to changing priorities and evolving technologies in a fast-paced scaleup environment.
* **Collaboration:** Strong teamwork abilities for effective cross-functional engagement and knowledge sharing.
* **Problem-Solving Mindset:** Proactively identify challenges and devise innovative solutions to drive progress and improve processes.

**Equal opportunity employer**


We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.

 **Application**


Ready to make the world *feel* your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “interested” below.

**About Epidemic Sound:**


Epidemic Sound has transformed the soundtracking experience for global brands and professional creators, with an expansive catalog of world-class music and sound effects that's seen and heard over 2.5 billion times a day around the globe. Providing a direct license model that comes with all rights included and next-generation soundtracking tools, Epidemic Sound empowers creators to unlock more feeling in everything they create and share their stories with the world. Epidemic Sound continuously enriches its world-class catalog of music by teaming up with artists, composers, and producers to create tracks spanning all genres, while supporting them financially and creatively.

title: Software Engineer in Prepaid Payments (Full Stack or Frontend Focus)
description:
**Job ID:** 268597


**Date posted:** 05/12/2024

  

  

  

HEJ! (Swedish for Hi)
  

We’re searching for an engineer who is excited about technology and innovative ways of working and wants to be a part of shaping the future of payments at IKEA!
  

IKEA’s vision is to “create a better everyday life for the many people” by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low, that as many people as possible will be able to afford them. This spirit of access needs to be supported by amazing software systems, and we would like to ask if you want to be a part of this.
  

We’re building a seamless payment experience for the many people.
  

How do we do this? We transform the complex landscape of payments into easy-to-use platforms. We create an environment that celebrates new ideas. We take a data-driven approach to continuous improvement, and we create systems that are secure, scalable, and resilient. And, in true IKEA fashion, we do it in the spirit of collaboration and togetherness.
  

  

THE OPPORTUNITY  

You will help us modernize and create a user-friendly omnichannel prepaid payment platform within IKEA to process many thousands of prepaid payment transactions for 30+ markets worldwide. A security-focused approach is paramount for us and our customers. And, since our mission is access, prepaid payments need to “just work”, so resiliency and scalability are equally important. In this role, you will report to an engineering manager in the Payments capability area. The Malmö/ Helsingborg office in Sweden will be your home location.
  

  

DO YOU HAVE THESE ESSENTIALS?  

When you visit our website (IKEA.com) and read about our culture and values it resonates with you. You are curious and view failure as a way of learning and pushing your skills. You believe in taking a pragmatic approach and value simplicity when building new solutions. You also have:
  

* Experience in designing high-quality services using JVM-based languages, preferably Java.
* You’ve got a passion for the frontend and an eye for a good UI and UX, preferably with React experience.
* Experience and desire to deliver secure, scalable, and resilient services based on DevOps principles.
* Familiarity with cloud computing platforms – preferably GCP (Google Cloud Platform), but other platforms are great too!
* The ability to design continuous integration/delivery pipelines and have used CI tools such as GitHub Actions, Jenkins or TeamCity.
* Experience using deployment automation tools such as Terraform and GitHub Actions.
* An understanding of modern observability practices such as distributed tracing, structured logging and metrics.
* Have great written and verbal communication skills.

  

DO YOU HAVE THESE DESIRABLES?  

* Experience working in e-commerce and online payments.
* Familiarity with building web applications using modern frameworks and best practices.

  

WHAT DO WE OFFER?  

* A direct impact on the lives of millions of people worldwide. With us, you’ll be challenged to create scalable solutions that have a direct customer impact in 30+ markets around the world.
* A challenging yet fun work environment. We believe that technical excellence and collaboration are key, and fun is a must.
* Continuous learning. We want to invest in you and your future. With our 80/20 rule, you’ll spend 80% of your time working on a product and 20% working on yourself.
* A place to be you. Diversity and inclusion are written into our company’s DNA. When you work at IKEA, you’ll join a welcoming community where you can be creative and be yourself.

  

A FEW WORDS FROM THE MANAGER  

Our team has grown into a productive and well-rounded group of diverse, talented engineers who are driving the modernization of IKEA's payment platforms. We’re proud of our strong culture of responsibility, trust, and open communication—core values at IKEA that we live by every day. Recently, one of our senior engineers was promoted to a manager role, and now we’re looking for a new core-level engineer to join us on this exciting journey.
  

We empower every team member to experiment, test, and deliver high-quality solutions, always learning from both success and failure. Agility and adaptability are in our DNA. Our engineers are more than just solution providers—they are an integral part of the product team, contributing to impactful work that directly improves our customers' experiences.
  

If you're customer-obsessed, passionate about learning, and eager to have a real influence on a product that touches millions, we invite you to join our dynamic and diverse team! The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day-to-day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA, it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more about our values and life at IKEA on our website www.ikea.com.
  

  

QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT  

The role is based in Helsingborg but the team also use the Hubhult, Malmö office as well.
  

If you have questions, want to apply, want to know more about our values or are unsure about the requirements or anything else, please reach out to the Recruiter Rosie Geraghty- rosie.geraghty@ingka.com . You can also find out more about Technology at Ingka Digital at https://tech.ingka.com/  

  

Please note that we will be interviewing continuously. We do anticipate a slight delay with the interviewing process over the festive period, so please be aware that interviews may not occur until early January 2025. We look forward to hearing from you!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Software Engineer - Cloud Networking
description:
**About Neo4j:**

Neo4j is the leader in Graph Database & Analytics, helping organizations uncover hidden patterns and relationships across billions of data connections deeply, easily, and quickly. Customers use Neo4j to gain a deeper understanding of their business and reveal new ways of solving their most pressing problems. Over 84% of Fortune 100 companies use Neo4j, along with a vibrant community of 250,000+ developers, data scientists, and architects across the globe.



At Neo4j, we’re proud to build the technology that powers breakthrough solutions for our customers. These solutions have helped NASA get to Mars two years earlier, broke the Panama Papers for the ICIJ, and are helping Transport for London to cut congestion by 10% and save $750M a year. Some of our other notable customers include Intuit, Lockheed Martin, Novartis, UBS, and Walmart.



Neo4j experienced rapid growth this year as organizations looking to deploy generative AI (GenAI) recognized graph databases as essential for improving it’s accuracy, transparency, and explainability. Growth was further fueled by enterprise demand for Neo4j’s cloud offering and partnerships with leading cloud hyperscalers and ecosystem leaders. Learn more at neo4j.com and follow us on LinkedIn.

  


**Our Vision:**

At Neo4j, we have always strived to help the world make sense of data.



As business, society and knowledge become increasingly connected, our technology promotes innovation by helping organizations to find and understand data relationships. We created, drive and lead the graph database category, and we’re disrupting how organizations leverage their data to innovate and stay competitive.


**The Team:**



The managed cloud offering from Neo4j is called Aura (DBaaS) and we are now looking to expand our Aura team with more skilled Engineers. As of today, Aura is running more than 500 managed Kubernetes clusters in production across multiple CSPs. Both, the number of clusters and the need for new functionality is growing rapidly.



Now, we are looking for experienced, Senior Cloud Network Engineers with Kubernetes experience to join our Networking team to develop the system further to handle future load and functionality.


**The Role:**


* Collaborate with your team to design, develop, and maintain the cloud networking foundation that powers our cutting-edge solutions.
* Partner closely with teams across Neo4j’s cloud organization, Aura, to shape and deliver an ambitious roadmap for cloud networking as we scale globally.
* Tackle complex and exciting engineering challenges in a rapidly growing area of focus, where your work will directly influence the performance, reliability, and scalability of our platform.

**Required areas of experience:**
---------------------------------


* Advanced knowledge of Google Could, AWS and/or Azure
* Agile software development within a team environment
* Good working knowledge of Go
* Custom Kubernetes operators
* Working in a 24/7/365 SaaS environment
* Solid understanding of DNS, TLS, mTLS, SNI and IPv6
* Kubernetes networking
* Build and deployment pipelines employing continuous delivery

**Nice to have areas of experience:**
-------------------------------------


* Multi-tenancy environments
* GCP Private Service Connect
* AWS/Azure PrivateLink
* Kubernetes internal networks (Cilium, eBPF, Traefik, Calico, Linkerd, Istio, Consul)
* Kubernetes network security
* Architecting for high availability
**Why Join Neo4j?**

Neo4j is, without question, the most popular graph database in the world. We have customers in every industry globally, and our products are a proven product/market fit. Joining our team is an opportunity to shape the future of data and analytics. Below are just a few exciting facts about Neo4j.


* Neo4j is one of the fastest-scaling technology companies in this industry. It recently surpassed $200M in annual recurring revenue (ARR), doubling its ARR over the past three years.
* Raised the biggest funding round in database history ($325M Series F). Backed by world-class investors like Eurazeo, GV (formerly Google Ventures), and Inovia Capital, Neo4j has raised over $600M in funding and is currently valued at over $2Bn. This puts Neo4j among the most well-funded database companies in history.
* 84% of the Fortune 100 and 58% of the Fortune 500 use Neo4j. Examples include Boston Scientific, BT Group, Caterpillar, Cisco, Comcast, Department for Education UK, eBay, NBC News, Novo Nordisk, Worldline, and others.
* Co-founder and CEO Emil Eifrem has built an amazing culture that prides itself on relationships, inclusiveness, innovation, and customer success.
* Countless industry awards. Massive enterprises and individual developers/data scientists love Neo4j. A strong sense of community and ecosystem is built around the platform.
* A recent Forrester Total Economic Impact™ Study cited Neo4j as delivering 417% ROI to customers.
* Neo4j was named as a Visionary in the 2023 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud Database Management Systems among 19 other recognized global DBMS vendors. Neo4j was also ranked as a Strong Performer among 14 top vendors in The Forrester Wave™: Vector Databases, Q3 2024.


Research shows that members of underrepresented communities are less likely to apply for jobs when they don’t meet all the qualifications. **If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we’d encourage you to reconsider and give us the opportunity to review your application.** At Neo4j, we are committed to building awareness and helping to improve these issues.



One of our central objectives is to provide an inclusive, diverse, and equitable workplace for everyone to develop their potential and have a positive, career-defining experience. We look forward to receiving your application.



**Neo4j Values:**

Neo4j is a Silicon Valley company with a Swedish soul. We foster collaboration and each of us is empowered to contribute and put our innovative stamp on projects. We hire candidates who reflect the following Neo4j core values:



(we)-[:VALUE]->(relationships)  

(we)-[:FOCUS\_ON]->(userSuccess)  

(we)-[:THRIVE\_IN]->(:Culture {type: [‘Open’, ‘Inclusive’]})  

(we)-[:ASSUME]->(:Intent {direction:’Positive’})  

(we)-[:WELCOME]->(:Discussions {nature: ‘IntellectuallyHonest’})  

(we)-[:DELIVER\_ON]->(ourCommitments)



Neo4j is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Please read the privacy notice regarding Neo4j's recruitment process to understand how we will handle the personal data that you provide.
