title: Principal Civil Engineer
description:
**Job Overview:**

The Principal Civil Engineer interprets internal or external business issues and recommends best practices. They will be tasked with solving complex Civil Engineering-related problems and work independently with minimal guidance. The Principal Civil Engineer may lead functional teams or projects and is considered a specialist. As such, they must have in-depth expertise in Civil Engineering and broad knowledge of the Civil discipline within the Engineering function.


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Perform conceptual, FEED, and detailed analyses and design as per design basis, project specifications, design codes, and standards
* Apply in-depth skills and broad knowledge of the business to address complex problems and nonstandard situations
* Prepare clear and accurate detailed design calculations and analyses, including design reports and - procedures
* Manage own time to meet objectives and (as Lead Engineer) forecast and plan resource requirements
* Communicate and explain difficult concepts and persuade others to adopt a point of view
* When acting as Lead Engineer, in addition:
	+ Direct medium or large Engineering team as a Lead Engineer
	+ Lead the Discipline engineering design of the assigned work area and complete it within the planned schedule and budget, by standards, MDR, and project-specific procedures and to a high professional standard
	+ Plan, organize, and direct all aspects of Discipline execution on the assigned project, including scope, deliverables, schedule, and all workforce resources - agree on allocations with the Discipline Manager
	+ Ensure interfaces and deliverables are identified
	+ Maintain responsibility for progress and productivity, identifying any required corrective action
	+ Act as project representative for the Discipline during meetings with Project Team,
	+ Customer discipline lead and relevant agencies such as certifying authorities, auditors, third parties, etc.
* Train/mentor other employees in the department
* Assist and monitor MOPEX offices on projects
* Initiate interface with other disciplines to obtain input for discipline designs
* Help to maintain Unifi
* Prepare bids from sketching data, using experience
* Supervise engineers and designers
* Define scopes of work for engineering/construction fabrication yard
* Provide engineering support as required
* Perform engineering checks of drafting
* Perform engineering checks prepared by others within the discipline
* Perform design verification through single discipline check and assist with inter-discipline checks (IDC)
* Prepare MTOs of foundations and structures
* Prepare specifications
* Prepare subcontracts
* Review of vendor data
* Prepare technical bid evaluations
* Assist in furthering the department
* Tasks as Engineering Specialist:
	+ Coordinate and check the work of senior and junior engineers
	+ Conduct peer reviews on request
	+ Provide technical assistance where required
	+ Prepare structural analyses and report on calculations or perform specialist tasks (i.e., architectural designs, underground piping designs, complex foundations/structures, weight control reports, the center of gravity reports)
	+ Specialized in several fields (geotechnical, steel, concrete, dynamic calculations, FEM, fatigue calculations, earthquake, blast, hydrodynamics, architectural)
	+ Specialized in several design codes (EC, ACI/AISC/API, GOST)
	+ Check designs for operational requirements, constructability, and maintainability
	+ Prepare project engineering guides
* Tasks as Lead Engineer:
	+ Work as Lead Engineer on medium to large-size EPC projects
	+ Full responsibility for all engineering and design work on any project
	+ Full control and manages work hours, materials, progress
	+ Work in close liaison with the Design Coordinator
	+ Set up all engineering computer systems
	+ Assist the Project Manager in:
		- Prepare deliverable control
		- Prepare schedule
		- Prepare progress reports
		- Prepare man-hour and capital expenditure estimates
* Coordinate with project management
* Train personnel under their supervision
* Responsible for discipline within the engineering group
* Manage (design) subcontracts
* Identify and manage changes in the scope of work
* Responsible for filing engineering work
* Give relevant feedback to the department

Reports to:
   

Project: Lead Engineer, Project Engineering Manager or Project Manager
   

Functional: Supervising Department Manager
   

Liaise With: All Engineering disciplines, Construction site/Fabrication Group, Safety Dept, Project Management Team,
   

Document Control, Project Planner, Project Cost Controller, QC and Certification Group, Procurement Group, Subcontractors
   

and Vendors, and Customers
   

Supervises: Senior Engineers, Engineers and Designers


  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Engineering
* 15-20 years in oil and gas with a major contractor or consultant, predominantly performing detail design
* Detailed knowledge of design techniques and analysis methods and detailed knowledge of the theory, content, and application of standards, codes, and guidelines as applicable
* Knowledgeable in project coordination and execution skills
* Preferably Registered Professional Engineer or member of professional engineering society as applicable
* Seasoned structural knowledge
* Very good organizer, motivator, and supervisor
* Able to solve problems without assistance
* Keen on improving the effectiveness of the work
* HSE, TQM, and cost-conscious
* Fluent in English, both oral and written
* Understanding and supporting company goals and work processes
* Show flexibility and ensure proper hand-over with regards to:
	+ The reassignment to other departments/construction sites/fabrication yards
	+ The replacement of colleagues during illness and holidays
	+ The provision of assistance to other colleagues with heavy workloads (also other projects) when possible/desirable
	+ The managing/learning of current working methods and software applications
* Reassignment to other McDermott offices
* Good understanding of the other engineering departments
* Good understanding of construction/fabrication yard and client requirements
* Commercial insight

#LI-PF1

title: Hydraulikingenjör
description:
ERIAN Engineering AB etablerades 2014 och är en ingenjörsfirma baserad i Linköping som jobbar med automation och hydraulik till olika maskiner, fartyg och industrier. Vi arbetar mycket mot de internationella marin och offshore segmenten och har många spännande projekt i hela världen. Vi söker nu efter en hydraulikingenjör som ska hjälpa till med design av olika hydrauliska system. Arbetsuppgifter är ritning och systemdesign av hydraulik till olika maskiner, val av komponenter , beräkningar av tryckfall och flöden. Det ingår också att göra dokumentation och att samverka med el och software ingenjörer för att ta fram en komplett fungerande produkt. Reseverksamhet för uppstarter förekommer. Här finns det möjlighet att lära sig av några av dom bästa i branschen och samtidigt få uppleva många spännande platser i världen. För rätt person finns det också bra möjligheter till utveckling, att kunna ta ett större ansvar för egna projekt och kunder.
  
Vi anmodar också nyutexaminerade och studenter som läser sista året att också söka på denna tjänst.
  
MSc / BSc Maskinteknik/ Mekatronik / Hydraulik gärna från LiTH FLUMES
  
Kunskap om systemdesign och beräkningar av hydrauliska system.
  
Kunskap om val av komponenter.
  
Hands on erfarenhet av uppstarter av hydraulsystem och andra maskiner är meriterande.
  
Hands on erfarenhet av montering av rör / slangar / fittings är meriterande.
  
God förståelse av styrsystem och vad som krävs för styrning av hydraulik.
  
God förståelse av elektriska system, förmåga att läsa och förstå elritningar.
  
Förmåga att använda AutoCAD 2D eller liknade programvara för att göra ritningar.
  
  

Urval sker löpande.
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Electrical Engineer-Electrical System Integration
description:
Join Our Team as an Electrical Engineer at Berg Propulsion!
  
Are you a talented Electrical Engineer looking for an exciting opportunity to advance your career? Look no further! Berg Propulsion, a leading global engineering company, is seeking a dedicated Engineer to join our Electrical System IntegrationTeam.At Berg Propulsion, we pride ourselves on our innovative approach and commitment to excellence. Our team is composed of experts who collaborate closely to support customers with new projects and field issues. We value diversity, expertise, and a collaborative spirit, making us a leader in the engineering industry.Your Role: As an Electrical Engineer at Berg Propulsion, you will be instrumental in designing, developing, and testing cutting-edge electrical systems and components. Your problem-solving skills will be crucial in identifying and resolving issues, as well as enhancing our products and procedures. You will work in a dynamic environment, collaborating with other engineers and cross-functional teams to ensure project success.Key Responsibilities: - Design & Development: Create and test innovative electrical systems and components.- Problem-Solving: Identify and address issues with electrical systems and components.- Collaboration: Work with other engineers and cross-functional teams to achieve project goals.- Documentation: Develop and maintain detailed technical documentation.- Process Improvement: Develop procedures, workflows, and design tools to enhance team efficiency.Qualifications: - Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.- Minimum of 3 years of experience in electrical engineering.- Proficiency with CAD software and electrical design tools.- Strong problem-solving abilities.- Independent, driven, and self-motivated mindset.- Excellent communication skills and ability to thrive in a team environment.- Experience in the maritime industry is a plus.Why Join Us?- Innovative Projects: Work on challenging and exciting projects that make a real impact.- Collaborative Environment: Join a supportive team where your expertise is valued.- Global Opportunities: Be part of a company with a global reach and influence.- Professional Growth: Opportunities for continuous learning and career advancement.If you are passionate about electrical engineering and eager to contribute to a team that values innovation and excellence, we would love to hear from you!Take the next step in your career and join Berg Propulsion.
  
  

BERG PROPULSION is one of the world's leading designers and producers of Controllable Pitch Propellers. We deliver fully customized main propellers, azimuth thrusters, transverse thrusters and maneuver systems.We stand before exciting times with a transformation in the marine sector where electrification and automation will be a key to fulfill the environmental requirements. With our vision “to make global shipping safe and sustainable” in focus we want to be a part of this journey, driving development of tomorrows solutions and contribute to a sustainable future for the industry.
  
  

If you have questions about the role or want to know more, please contact recruiting manager Mattias Dombrowe at: mattias.dombrowe@bergpropulsion.com

title: Crane Currency has an immediate opening for a Production Manager in Tumba
description:
**Who we are:**  

Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverage proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations. ​
  
  

**How you will make an impact:**  

You will lead a team of professionals in our cotton and pulp preparation, a crucial part of the bank note paper making process. Your team will respond to your ability to motivate and inspire others to achieve our daily goals related to safety, quality, delivery, cost and growth.
  
Our external customers look to you and your team to build the products that their economies need. Colleagues will benefit from your structured and goal-oriented way of working. You will report to the Managing Director and be instrumental in developing and driving strategic plans for the department.
  
  

**Other responsibilities:**  

* Achieve long- and short-term goals according to Business plan and budget goals for the department.
* Department responsibility for a Supervisor, Production Engineer, Process Engineer and 27 operators.
* Ensure that deviations related to Safety, Quality, delivery, cost and growth are managed within the department.
* Ensure collaboration with other departments to achieve Pulp and Cotton Production goals.
* Delegate work environment task responsibilities and manage systematic work environment processes to maintain a safe and productive workplace.
* Ensure an effective Organizational Structure, continuously develop employees in accordance with current regulations, providing training and growth opportunities to enhance their skills and performance.


**Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:****Required:**  

Master of science in engineering or chemistry or commensurate experience.
  
10 years’ experience working in the process/paper industry.
  
5 years’ experience in a supervisory position or as a manager
  
Very good written and spoken knowledge of the English and Swedish language.
  
Good computer skills.
  
  

**Preferred:**  

Experience working with lean and continuous improvement.
  
**Results-driven and organized:** Demonstrates a strong focus on achieving goals and maintaining a systematic approach to tasks.
  
**Strong prioritization skills:** Effectively identifies and concentrates on the most critical tasks to ensure optimal productivity.
  
**Experience with multi-year strategic planning:** Skilled in developing and executing long-term plans to achieve organizational objectives.
  
**Excellent leadership and direction:** Provides clear guidance and inspires teams to perform at their best
  
  

**How we will care for you:**  

Top-notch medical benefits – We take care of you with our wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care.
  
Personal development – We want you to grow with us. Through lunch & learns, career ladders and more.
  
Community Engagement – Give yourself time to support the local community and environment through volunteer events and on-site initiatives to benefit local communities and organizations.
  
There’s more – Competitive compensation , vacation, parental leave, and retirement plans.
  
  

**What drives our team:**  

We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:
  
People Matter
  
Do the Right Thing
  
Trusted Partner
  
Innovate for Growth
  
Always Improving
  
  

People are at the center of all that we do, from our employees to our customers and our communities. We empower our teams to help shape the Crane Currency experience, embracing and celebrating our unique perspectives and differences to learn from each other and grow stronger together. To learn more about life at Crane Currency, visit www.cranecurrency.com.
  
  

**Where we are:**  

Your role is in Tumba, Stockholm, located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, 10 -minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Tumba is a small suburb in an area with different cultures from all corners of the world. The area offers a beautiful landscape and countryside feeling. You can spend the day to explore the shopping mall nearby, enjoy the surrounding nature, or take the train into the vibrant pulse of Stockholm City to enjoy the many restaurants, shopping, sightseeing and stroll through beautiful Downtown, Gamla Stan.
  
-----
  
Crane Currency is a drug free workplace.
  
Crane NXT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
Sana is an AI company transforming how organizations learn and access knowledge. Our products are trusted by the world’s most pioneering companies—from Electrolux and Merck to Alan and Svea Solar.


In 2024, Sana was recognized on the Forbes AI 50 list as one of the top AI companies developing the most promising business use cases of artificial intelligence.


If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.

**Join Sana as a Solutions Engineer**
=====================================


Our Solutions Engineering team plays a pivotal role in bridging the gap between our product development and client-facing teams for our latest product, Sana AI. The team prides itself on its adaptability, entrepreneurial spirit, and relentless pursuit of excellence. Many team members have joined from previous workplaces like Google AI, Spotify, BCG, and McKinsey.


It’s an exciting time to be working with AI, especially at Sana. Our goal is to build an AI assistant for work with infinite capabilities—one that can process any amount of information, answer any question, assist with all knowledge work, and ultimately solve difficult problems autonomously. This means you’ll get to work with state-of-the-art LLMs, and be on the frontlines of operationalizing the potential of AI within some of the most pioneering companies around the globe.


As the Sana AI's footprint expands through an increasing client based and users, your role will likely evolve to include the coaching and onboarding of additional solution engineers, as well as the scaling the designed and implemented solution, and the creation and the iterations on the playbooks required to make the Sana AI solutions succeed at scale.

**What you’ll do**
==================

* Provide dedicated technical support during pre-sales and implementation phases, ensuring that client queries are addressed promptly and accurately.
* Engage directly with clients, especially large enterprises, to build trust and credibility by demonstrating deep technical knowledge.
* Collaborate closely with product managers and engineers to stay updated on the latest product developments and ensure seamless communication between teams.
* Address complex technical issues that arise during sales and deployment, ensuring that solutions are implemented efficiently and effectively.
* Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the efficiency of the sales and deployment processes.

**You should apply if**
=======================

* You have a strong technical background with experience in software engineering, systems engineering, or a related field.
* You have proven experience in a client-facing technical role, preferably within the tech industry.
* You have excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to address complex technical issues quickly and effectively.
* You have strong verbal and written communication skills and can explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* You enjoy working collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and sales teams.
* You have a self-starter mindset, meaning you can proactively identify issues and opportunities and tackle them without being told to do so.

**What we offer**
=================

* The opportunity to empower organizations across the globe to solve the world’s most important problems faster by transforming how they access knowledge with AI
* Competitive base salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program
* Fast career development opportunities in a rapidly evolving entrepreneurial environment
* A role based in Stockholm with access to centrally-located offices in NYC and London, all designed as a space for you to do your life's work.


Compensation Range: $10K - $15K
company_description: Als einer der größten Gesundheitsdienstleister in der DACH-Region verfügt Sana über verschiedene Business Units (Gesundheitsversorgung, Krankenhaus-Services und Gesundheit).

title: Test Rig Engineer
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **5+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

 **Rollbeskrivning**:

**Operational Test Rig Engineer**  

In Clients Software Test Center we operate a large number of test rigs and in order to manage this we both need a high level of automation, but we also need a high level of capability when it comes to rig fault tracing, testing and planning of usage.  

In this role you will work as a team member in the operational team responsible for the operation pf boxcars, VILs and other rig types.  

We are looking for additional team members with the following competence.  

  

**Hands-on experience**  

1. Basetech Testing (SWDL, Diagnostic, Gateway etc.)  

2. Log Analysis in CANoe, Wireshark, DLT etc.  

3. Basic electrical Fault tracing in Test object (Boxcar, Components rigs etc.)  

  

**Tools knowledge -**  

1. Vector tools (CANoe/CANAlyzer)  

2. Basic understanding of CAN/LIN/Ethernet protocol  

3. Basic knowledge of simulation (ECU simulation, frame simulation etc.)  

4. Some experience working in Linux env  

  

Also positive if the candidate has some knowledge about continuous integration, baseline and binary management and general test automation. Since the team is working in a rapidly changing environment it is very important that candidates have a positive and progressive mindset.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Deep Learning Engineer
description:
**About Embedl**

  

Embedl is a fast-growing technology start-up based in Gothenburg, Sweden. With a team of over 20 dedicated professionals, we are on a mission to make AI affordable and efficient in embedded systems. Our development team is headquartered in Gothenburg, and our innovative solutions serve customers all over the world. We maintain close connections with academic research institutions, industry leaders, and the innovation ecosystem, supported by strong relationships with venture capital partners.

**The Role**

  

We are seeking a talented **Deep Learning Engineer** to join our team in developing our flagship product, the **Embedl SDK**—a Python library that empowers businesses to create efficient AI models, optimized for embedded hardware.

**Responsibilities**

* **Implementing features and functions** in Embedl’s software products to enhance performance and user experience.
* **Benchmarking optimization algorithms** by training models and deploying them to hardware.
* **Improving hardware support** by integrating AI tools from industry leaders such as Nvidia, Intel, Xilinx, ARM, Qualcomm, STMicroelectronics, Ambarella, Texas Instruments, and NXP.

**Who You Are**

  

You are a curious and hands-on developer with excellent problem-solving skills, ready to help us deliver a modern and high-quality software product. You are self-driven, communicative, and thrive when given high-level responsibilities and complex problems to solve. As a team player, you are eager to learn from others and contribute to a positive working environment.

**Qualifications**

 **Must-Have**

* **Academic degree** in Computer Science, Physics, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent skills achieved through experience.
* **Excellent coding skills in Python**.
* Experience developing deep learning models using **PyTorch, Jax, Keras** and/or **TensorFlow**.
* Experience with libraries for scientific computing, such as **Numpy, Scipy** and **Matplotlib**.
* **2-5 years of industry experience** in software development, preferably in sectors like automotive or telecom where code quality is paramount.

**Nice-to-Have**

* Familiarity with developing AI models for embedded hardware.
* Experience with C, C++, CUDA.
* FPGA or embedded programming.
* Knowledge of data visualization tools.
* Experience working in a Linux environment.
* Experience with Git, Docker, and Agile methodologies.

**What We Offer**

 **Collaborative Culture:** Join a high-performance team that values teamwork, knowledge sharing, and a positive working environment.

**Professional Growth:** Opportunities for continuous learning, mentorship, and career advancement.

**Benefits:** Health and wellness allowance (friskvårdsbidrag) of 5000 SEK and private health insurance.

**Application Process**

  

The selection and interview process is ongoing, so please send your application in English as soon as possible. For any questions or clarifications, reach out to our HR Manager Ann Tornberg at jobs@embedl.com.


You are welcome at Embedl for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what your favorite IDE is.


Join us at Embedl and be a part of shaping the future of efficient AI!

title: Test automation engineer to Axis Communications!
description:
Are you passionate about software testing, programming, and quality assurance? Do you thrive in collaborative environments and enjoy working with innovative automated testing methods? If so, this position in Lund might be your next career move!

**About Axis Communications**  

Axis Communications is a global leader in network technology, offering cutting-edge solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems. By leveraging intelligent analytics and innovation, they empower businesses to improve security and performance.


With more than 4500 employees in over 50 countries, their inclusive culture is built on collaboration, diversity, and sustainability. At Axis, you’ll find a supportive environment where your ideas matter, and your personal and professional growth is prioritized.

**About the Team & Role**  

You’ll join the New Business QA Team, a group of skilled engineers with diverse expertise. They dedicated to ensuring their access control solutions meet the highest standards, building trust and satisfaction among their customers. Teamwork, shared learning, and a strong quality culture define them.


As a **Test Automation Engineer**, you’ll play a key role in:

* Developing and maintaining test automation frameworks and cases.
* Supporting other test teams with tools and visualization for test results.
* Innovating and refining environments, methods, and processes.
* Sharing knowledge through mentoring and training.

**This is a Consultancy Role with Recruitment Potential**  

While you will be employed as a consultant by **Ed:Za**, you will be working on-site at Axis Communications. There is an opportunity for **over-recruitment**, meaning a chance to transition to a permanent role at Axis once the consultancy period is over.

 **Who You Are**  

Axis are looking for someone who loves problem-solving and has a strong passion for software quality and testing. You’re adaptable, eager to learn, and enjoy working closely with others in a collaborative environment.


You likely have:

* A degree in engineering or equivalent experience.
* Strong programming skills and experience with test automation.
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* Two years or more experience in relevant fields.


It’s a plus if you have:

* Experience with Python programming language
* An understanding of the interplay between hardware and software.


As a person, you’re creative, responsible, and approachable. You’re driven to push initiatives forward and value a culture where everyone learns and grows together.

**Welcome with your application!**  

Do you think this role might be a good fit for you, or perhaps someone you know? We review applications on a rolling basis and may fill the position before the application deadline, so don’t hesitate—send in your application today!


If you have any questions or concerns regarding the position or the process, please feel free to contact us.

title: Senior Verification Engineer
description:
**Senior Verification Engineer**

***Are you a verification engineer/product developer looking for your next opportunity?***

***Here you can make your mark and demonstrate how the very best organisations transfer products from R&D into a manufacturing environment.***


Biotage is looking for a driven individual to join a successful Swedish Global Life Science company. Biotage is an industry leader, developing innovative and effective platforms products for the Pharma, BioPharma, Biotech, Diagnostic and Environmental industries. Biotages’ products help our customers’ workflow in the discovery and development of new therapies


As a driven verification engineer, within the verification and validation group at R&D, you will ensure product quality and manufacturing efficiency through all phases of the product development. We are looking for a driven verification lead to act as a key part of the projects focused on the development of new instruments and consumables. The role involves networking with internal stakeholders and working as part of a multi- disciplinary team to deliver the highest quality products and processes.


Product optimisations (improvements to the existing product portfolio) are also central to the role. You will be encouraged to independently run small projects and tasks aimed at improving our existing products. You will use your initiative and expertise to make an impact by work hands-on, implementing and documenting design changes.


Biotage offers an innovative, collaborative and fertile work environment where you work and learn with stakeholders in regional marketing, R&D, supply chain, the global service team and customer support, in order to deliver the very best products and processes. As a valued Verification engineer, you will be an essential part of Biotage R&D and liasise with and report to the Director of Verification & Validation (V&V), based at Biotage Headquarters in Uppsala, Sweden.

**Job scope outline**

We work with newly developed systems, which entail hardware, software and often a consumable (e.g. column for separation). The job involves:

* Define and evaluate technical requirements
* Develop test cases from requirements
* Define, perform, evaluate, and report verification and validation tasks
* Plan and perform testing and verification on part, sub system and system levels
* Drive, coordinate and follow-up on product development and product care activities
* Document and administrate changes in our product life-cycle management systems
* Perform technical investigations (e.g. risk assessments and root-cause analyses)

**Education and Experience**

* Minimum BSc in Systems, Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical Engineering or similar
* Preferably a minimum of 8 years of experience within verification, validation or testing
* Previous experience within product development or quality assurance
* Experience in creating and maintaining test plan, test cases and writing reports
* Experience with acceptance test definition
* Experience from a controlled business or good documentation practice from elsewhere
* Experience in project coordination or mentoring is a merit
* Proven achievements in problem solving of hardware related issues is a merit

**Desired skills and qualities**

* To excel in this role, you should possess problem-solving skills and enjoy collaborating with others to achieve qualitative results
* Awareness of Lean principals of production delivery
* As a person you are communicative, driven, curious, proactive and flexible
* You have a quality focus and value the importance of product life-cycle management
* Personal drive and commitment are highly valued
* You possess a structured way of working
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and verbally

**Application**


We look forward to receiving your application, together with CV and a personal letter, no later than 5th of January 2025. In this recruitment we work together with our consultant Charlotta Babington Thorzelius. If you have any questions regarding the process please contact her on charlotta@hurekaresources.se

title: Field Test Engineer
description:
We are now searching for a Field Test Engineer for our Harvesting tool, experienced in Electronics and Software Development who will play a pivotal part in ensuring our technology!

 **The role:**


In this role you will have several areas of responsibilities; *Testing and Troubleshooting*, *Requirement demand towards suppliers*, *hands-on work* and *Documentation and Reporting*. Therefore, you play a pivotal role for AirForestry’s development. You will optimize electronic components, systems, and software for the prototypes, perform extensive testing and troubleshooting of both hardware and software to ensure reliability and performance, and provide constructive feedback to the team to support continuous improvement. Further, this means cooperating with suppliers to ensure that components and materials meet our specifications and quality demands, you are a hands-on team member who executes building and repairing prototypes to ensure our projects runs smoothly but also produce and maintain detailed documentation and requirement specification of our projects. You will also be a part of the development and maintenance of our software applications.

**Need to have:**

* Relevant education within robotics, electronics or similar area.
* Minimum 2-3 years of working with mechatronics or other related areas.
* Confident in working both independently and in teams.
* Strong problem solver and analytical ability.
* Strong ownership, dependability.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.

**Nice to have:**

* Experience in electronics design.
* Knowledge in power electronics.
* Experience in Software Development in Python or C++/C.
* A good understanding of wireless communication technology.
* Strong relationship to the forest, either through work experience or other relevant experience.
* 

*As a hands-on, problem solving and outdoorsy person - you’ll fit right in with the rest of us!* *You will be a part of a fast-paced and fun environment, working with cutting edge technology and become an important part of a tight-nit and humble team.* *Good words to describe us are quality oriented, problem solving, fact-based, kind and open - and we ask lots of questions. We are office first and Uppsala-based.*
